Note to Persons Answering the Pioneer Housing Questionnaire

Since early settlers lived in very different kinds of houses from one time to another, and according to different circumstances, this questionnaire has been divided into three parts:

PART I: The "temporary" shack, sod or log house.
- to include any early dwellings coming under this general description, even though the family may have lived in it for many years.

PART II: The permanent house.
- to include the better house built after living for a time in quarters mentioned above, a permanent home built upon arrival, or the "homestead shack" which may have been added to and continued as a permanent house.

PART III: General.
- including aspects applying to either Part I or Part II of the questionnaire.

Some persons will therefore answer only parts two and three, and others will be able to answer all three parts.

Please send your completed questionnaire to:
Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Note to Persons Answering the Pioneer Housing Questionnaire:

Since early settlers lived in very different kinds of houses from one time to another, and according to different circumstances, this questionnaire has been divided into three parts:

PART I: The "temporary" shack, sod or log house. To include any early dwellings coming under this general description, even though the family may have lived in it for many years.

PART II: The permanent house. To include the better house built after living for a time in quarters mentioned above, a permanent house built upon arrival, or the "wholesaled shack," which may have been altered, and continued as a permanent house.

PART III: General. Including aspects applying to either Part I or Part II of the questionnaire.

Some persons will therefore answer only parts two and three, and others will be able to answer all three parts.

Please send your completed questionnaire to:
